author: milos88
content:
I (mostly) finished my work on Glados. I deleted old instance (and db) and deployed new one, which you can find on old link: https://glados.ethdevops.io/
Few key points:
- Still running on the old history subnetwork. Once we have some nodes running on the new network, I will shut it down and restart it
    - For this, I will need some (preferable standalone) client that implements new history subnetwork (that Glados will use)
- Glados now only uses [client info from ping message](https://github.com/ethereum/portal-network-specs/blob/master/ping-extensions/extensions/type-0.md) (meaning, the "c" field of the ENR is no longer used)
    - That's why you will see many "Unknown" nodes that are actually nimbus
- Glados doesn't exactly care what protocol version is being used, but it depends on the client that it runs with
